info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 08 at 4:51PM EST until January 10 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in North Carolina... Pigeon River At Canton affecting Haywood County. .A potent storm system is expected to produce 3-6 inches of rainfall across the east and west forks of the Pigeon River watershed from from early Tuesday morning through Tuesday afternoon. This rainfall will quickly overwhelm saturated soils and result in excessive runoff and significant stream rises in both the East Fork and West Fork Pigeon rivers, with flash flooding possible. This excessive flow will cause portions of the Pigeon River from Max Thompson Rd to Clyde to exceed bankfull or Action/Advisory Stage, causing common, nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. If rainfall totals significantly exceed current forecasts, higher crests along the Pigeon River may occur, resulting in deeper inundation of common, flood-prone areas adjacent to the river. If necessary, a River Flood Warning may be required. Residents and business owners are encouraged to stay up-to-date by monitoring the latest river levels and forecasts, as conditions may change quickly. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. Minor flooding is possible. * WHERE...Pigeon River at Canton. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water may begin to flood parts of Vance Street closest to the river and some parts of Fiberville Road. At 10.0 feet, Water may approach the yards of some homes on and near Fiberville Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 2.0 feet and nearly steady. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet tomorrow evening. The river may continue to rise to near or just above Minor Flood Stage Wednesday morning. If the river significantly exceeds Minor Flood Stage, a River Flood Warning may be issued. Please closely monitor the latest levels and forecasts. - Action/Advisory Stage is 8.0 feet. - Minor Flood Stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued before Wednesday morning at 700 AM EST.
